text:
T-Pain’s "Buy U a Drank" has been a certified club anthem for years now; however, there’s a good chance most of you were singing it wrong the whole time.

On Wednesday, T-Pain went to Twitter to finally clarify the song’s lyrics—specifically the lines in the hook. Many people have sang the song: "I'ma buy you a drank / (Ooh wee) I'ma take you home with me." But the actual lyrics are: "I'ma buy you a drank (And then) I'ma take you home with me."

In retrospect, this makes a lot more sense. But don’t feel too bad if you’ve been messing up the lyrics for the past decade. T-Pain insists the lyrics are "whatever you want it to be." He’s just grateful that you enjoy the record.

It’s “and then” not “ooh wee” but really it’s whatever you want it to be just enjoy the song however you hear it. I just appreciate you listening. #BuyUADrank #THANX — T-Pain (@TPAIN) November 29, 2017

The news sparked shock and denial.

Shit crazy I really thought T-Pain said "oooooweee" in buy u a drank but he was saying "and then" I feel like my life is a lie deadass..... or is this The Mandela Effect 🤔 — 🌹TayMasterChef (@TayMasterChef) November 30, 2017

when t-pain said it’s “and theeen” instead of “ooh weee” when the buy u a drank chorus hits... pic.twitter.com/CW8bxdpJfy — Diego Molina (@__DiegoMolina__) November 30, 2017

I don’t hear no damn “and then” on “Buy U a Drank” 😂😂sorry T-Pain — Forever Filthy (@Taa_stee) November 30, 2017

POST CONTINUES BELOW

when you ran “Buy U A Drank” back 5 times and T-Pain still says “AAAAND THEEEENNN” instead of “OOOOWEEEE” pic.twitter.com/i2M425dp8P — woke up like this* (@_DSav) November 29, 2017

Goodnight everyone (except T-Pain who tried to change the lyrics of Buy U A Drank in 2017) Sleep tight ✨ — Solána (@NalediSibisi) November 29, 2017

POST CONTINUES BELOW

Woke up saw the infinity war trailer then found out T-Pain says “and theeen” and not “ooo wee” on Buy U A Drank.



Today’s been wild. — danielryanrod (@DanielRyanRod) November 29, 2017

T-Pain wasn’t done. Shortly after he cleared up the lyrics for "Buy U a Drank," he turned his attention to the 2010 DJ Khaled track "All I Do Is Win," which featured him, Rick Ross, Ludacris, and Snoop Dogg. Many people misheard the hook’s lyrics as: "Everybody hands go up / And they stay there, and stay there." But T-Pain revealed that the actual line is: “And they stay there, and they say yeah.”

He apologized for the misunderstanding.

I don’t wanna throw another wrench in your childhood but also it’s “Everybody hands go UP......... and they stay there....... AND THEY SAY YEAH” sorry 😐 #AlliDoIsWin I’m from #Tallahassee bro. That’s just how some of us talk. — T-Pain (@TPAIN) November 29, 2017

Twitter's mind was blown for a second time today:

It's too late to change All I Do is Win. My hands already went up and stayed there. And stayed there. No One said anything T-Pain. — Jenny (@MyCousinJenny) November 29, 2017

POST CONTINUES BELOW

T-Pain really got me questioning my entire childhood by revealing what he was really saying in Buy U a Drank and All I Do Is Win... damn pic.twitter.com/0Nltv31row — Court 🎈 (@LanaDelJournals) November 29, 2017

I really feel dumb. I just listened to “Buy You a Drink” & “All I Do Is Win” again just to hear T-Pain tell me my life was a lie. — jayvsjustyce.🥀 (@yajlingo) November 29, 2017
